hero.badge: Private Offline AI for Your Home
hero.title: SURSA — Under Your Control
hero.lead: SURSA is a local AI companion designed to live in your home environment and run on hardware you control — supporting daily life without turning it into cloud data.
hero.p2: Plug in the device, give it a name and a voice, and connect only what you choose — cameras, lights, appliances, calendars, or nothing at all. When helpful, SURSA can use official documentation to guide you clearly and safely.
hero.p3: At home it acts as a calm family assistant and an extra layer of awareness. At work it supports planning, procedures, and learning. The goal is not a “hacker machine” — it is a practical assistant that encourages lawful, constructive action.
hero.p4: Online access is optional and deliberate: use it for manuals, official instructions, or updates — then return to offline mode. Clear control, predictable behavior, long-term usefulness.

about.title: Why SURSA Exists
about.imageAlt: SURSA device — a private offline AI assistant for the home
about.p1: Most AI assistants rely on remote infrastructure. That can be convenient, but it often means personal routines and private details are processed outside the home.
about.p2: SURSA follows the opposite path: the core runs locally on hardware you own. When you need something online — for example an official manual or support contact — it can connect briefly by your command and then return offline.
about.p3: The idea is simple: you talk to SURSA, and it helps your home work. Provide a device model name or serial number and get practical, step-by-step guidance — from TVs and coffee makers to washing machines and garden systems.
about.p4: SURSA is built for real life: clear explanations, predictable routines, and practical help — without needing you to fight through endless menus and settings.
about.p5: For long-term continuity, SURSA is designed around structured text context (not raw audio or video storage by default). This keeps the system lightweight and gives users direct control over what is kept or removed.
about.p6: The system is built with a teacher mindset: if a request moves toward unsafe or unlawful behavior, SURSA explains consequences and offers safer, legal alternatives.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.p1: Artificial intelligence should serve people — not dominate everyday life. SURSA is built around human control, clarity, and responsibility.
mission.problemText: Many AI systems are designed around centralized cloud infrastructure and opaque data processing. This can create incentives that prioritize scale and engagement over user control and transparency.
mission.alternativeText: SURSA is a local-first assistant: the user owns the hardware, defines the rules, and decides when (or if) online access is used. The intent is practical help with clear boundaries.
mission.partnershipText: SURSA is designed as collaboration: human intent plus machine precision. The assistant should be predictable, accountable, and helpful — supporting decisions rather than replacing judgment.
mission.visionText: A future where AI belongs to people, not institutions: a simple household device — plug it in, connect what you choose, and keep intelligence private, local, and safe.

how.title: How SURSA Works
how.item1Title: 1. Local brain with one continuous channel
how.item1Text: SURSA is designed to maintain a continuous local context instead of resetting every session. Preferences and rules can persist over time, improving usefulness without constant re-training.
how.item2Text: When a new device enters the home, SURSA can help you understand it. If you enable online mode, it can retrieve official documentation and then explain operation in plain language.
how.item3Title: 3. Rules and automations defined by the user
how.item3Text: SURSA reacts only to rules you define — lighting on arrival, movement notifications, routine reminders, or “do nothing unless I ask.” The system does not invent behavior on its own.
how.item4Text: You choose how to interact: language, voice, and tone. The interface is designed to remain usable on mobile devices and assistive technologies, with multilingual support as a core design goal.
how.item5Title: 5. Support for real work and daily life
how.item5Text: SURSA focuses on practical help: reminders, checklists, step-by-step procedures, planning, and learning support — using only the tools and access you explicitly allow.
how.item6Text: If a request moves toward risky or unlawful directions, SURSA explains consequences and suggests safer alternatives. Long-term trust matters more than short-term answers.

technicalLayers.title: Technical Layers
technicalLayers.trustAnchor: The coordination layer described below is a reserved research concept. It is not implemented, not active, and has no financial or commercial role.
technicalLayers.intro: A simplified architecture overview: offline-first, privacy by design, and opt-in for anything external.

localCore.title: Local Core (offline-first)
localCore.text: Core reasoning, memory handling, and primary logic run locally on user-owned hardware to minimize exposure and external dependencies.

memory.title: Memory & Context
memory.text: Structured local context gives users control over what is stored, reviewed, or deleted. Raw audio or video is not retained by default.

tools.title: Tools & Integrations (opt-in)
tools.text: External services and integrations are optional and activated only when the user explicitly enables them.

coordination.title: Coordination Layer (reserved research concept)
coordination.text: A reserved concept for future research on inter-device coordination. It is not implemented, not active, and not part of the current system behavior.

technicalLayers.note: SURSA is a research and development initiative. Privacy, transparency, and user control remain first principles.

roadmap.title: Research Roadmap
roadmap.item1Text: A stable local core with voice interaction and continuous context used in daily testing.
roadmap.item2Text: Local sensors, cameras, and user-defined rules to better understand the home state without default cloud dependence.
roadmap.item3Text: A dedicated on-device system designed to run SURSA autonomously as a household unit.
roadmap.item4Text: Early research devices deployed with selected families and contributors to validate real-world usage.
roadmap.item5Text: Exploration of controlled inter-device coordination as research only. Not implemented in the current release.

team.title: Who Is Behind SURSA
team.p1: SURSA is developed by ETERNA TECHNOLOGY, an independent engineering company focused on privacy-respecting AI systems.
team.p2: The project grows from hands-on daily use of a working local core, with emphasis on reliability, transparency, and user control over data and behavior.
team.p3: Development is guided by long-term principles rather than short-term trends, with openness to contributors who share the same values: privacy, autonomy, and responsible AI use.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1: Is SURSA a finished consumer product?
faq.a1: Not yet. The core system is operational and used in real environments; dedicated hardware is still in development.
faq.q2: Does SURSA require constant internet access?
faq.a2: No. Internet access is optional and user-controlled. The system continues to function offline.
faq.a3: SURSA stores structured text-based context defined by the user. Raw audio or video is not stored by default.
faq.q4: Can users delete or control memory?
faq.a4: Yes. Memory is local and designed to be reviewable and removable under user control.
faq.a5: The user. Behavior, integrations, and access are explicitly defined by the person who owns the hardware.
faq.q6: Is there pricing, public availability, or an open signup?
faq.a6: Not at this stage. SURSA is an independent research initiative: no consumer sales, no public pricing, and no open signup are announced here. Limited testing may happen internally or by invitation.

whoIsYourOn.heroSubtitle: SURSA is a private offline-first AI assistant designed to live inside your home environment, run on hardware you control, and support daily life with clear, user-defined boundaries.
whoIsYourOn.shortTextStrong: SURSA is a personal local intelligence for home and everyday work
whoIsYourOn.shortTextSuffix: . It runs on your devices, communicates through voice and local connections, and stays under your direct control.
whoIsYourOn.whatIntro: SURSA is not just a gadget or an app. It is a system concept built around a local core, a controlled memory model, optional integrations, and a long-term plan for a practical offline household device.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem1Text: The intelligence runs on user-owned hardware and processes requests locally by default. Long-term context is stored as structured text, enabling continuity without default cloud storage.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem2Text: SURSA listens, answers, and can support computer workflows and compatible local devices — reminders, planning, step-by-step guidance, and basic operational help.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem3Text: When you bring a new device home, SURSA can help you understand it. If you enable online mode, it can retrieve official documentation and explain usage clearly and practically.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem4Text: SURSA can connect to cameras, sensors, and local automation systems — reacting only according to rules you define: lighting, notifications, presence checks, and simple safety routines.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem5Text: A dedicated device similar to a Wi-Fi router, designed to run SURSA locally as a household intelligence hub — without default reliance on external cloud infrastructure.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem6Text: A reserved concept for future research on inter-device coordination. It is not implemented, not active, and has no financial or commercial role in the current system.
whoIsYourOn.notIntro: To avoid confusion, here is what SURSA does not aim to be:
whoIsYourOn.notItem1: SURSA is not a cloud service that continuously streams personal life data to remote servers.
whoIsYourOn.notItem2: SURSA is not a tool for illegal actions, hacking, or bypassing security systems.
whoIsYourOn.notItem3: SURSA is not a speculative trading product built around hype.
whoIsYourOn.notItem4: SURSA is not a replacement for certified medical, legal, or professional advice.
whoIsYourOn.principle1Text: The main intelligence operates inside the home network. Online access is optional and explicitly controlled by the user.
whoIsYourOn.principle2Text: SURSA is designed to remain useful even with unstable or no internet connection, because core behavior and context are local.
whoIsYourOn.principle3Text: Long-term hardware plans include a physical on/off switch. When switched off, there is no processing and no network activity.
whoIsYourOn.principle4Text: SURSA supports real work and daily decisions, guiding toward lawful, safe, and constructive actions.
whoIsYourOn.principle5Text: System behavior is defined by user permissions and rules. No hidden access, no silent data export, and no forced online dependence.
whoIsYourOn.archIntro: SURSA uses a layered model that separates local intelligence, home devices, and optional external access:
whoIsYourOn.archStep1Text: The reasoning engine runs on user-owned hardware with voice interaction, system tools, and local context storage.
whoIsYourOn.archStep2Text: Cameras, sensors, and automation devices inside the local network, without mandatory external relays.
whoIsYourOn.archStep3Text: Used only when explicitly needed — manuals, official instructions, fresh information, or remote access (if enabled).
whoIsYourOn.forWhomItem1: Families who want an assistant without constant data leakage to the cloud.
whoIsYourOn.forWhomItem2: Users who prioritize privacy, autonomy, and local control.
whoIsYourOn.forWhomItem3: People with busy schedules who rely on routines, reminders, and clear planning.
whoIsYourOn.forWhomItem4: Skilled professionals and workers who need a practical assistant, not a toy.
whoIsYourOn.forWhomItem5: Elderly relatives who benefit from gentle, family-configured support.
whoIsYourOn.companyP1: SURSA is developed by ETERNA ENGINEERING S.R.L., an independent engineering company focused on practical, privacy-respecting AI systems for real homes.
whoIsYourOn.companyP2: The company plans to expand engineering and research teams and collaborate with contributors who share the values of autonomy, transparency, and responsible AI use.
whoIsYourOn.quickQ1Title: Is SURSA a finished consumer device?
whoIsYourOn.quickQ1Text: Not yet. The core intelligence already runs locally on real hardware and is actively tested. Dedicated hardware prototypes are in development.
whoIsYourOn.quickQ2Title: Does SURSA require constant internet access?
whoIsYourOn.quickQ2Text: No. Internet access is optional and used only for explicitly requested tasks.
whoIsYourOn.quickQ3Title: Does SURSA store raw audio or video?
whoIsYourOn.quickQ3Text: Not by default. The system is designed around structured text context. Any media handling would be explicit and opt-in.
whoIsYourOn.quickQ4Title: What is the main idea behind SURSA?
whoIsYourOn.quickQ4Text: A personal AI that feels like a long-term partner — helping users become more capable, not more dependent.

pressCenter.heroSubtitle: This page contains verified project information: progress updates, roadmap milestones, and practical notes about privacy and responsible use. SURSA is developed as an offline-first system designed to stay under direct user control.
pressCenter.news1Title: Local core is running in daily testing
pressCenter.news1Text: The current SURSA core operates locally on user-owned hardware and is used in day-to-day workflows. The focus is stability: continuous context, predictable behavior, and practical assistance without default cloud dependence. Online access remains optional and user-controlled.
pressCenter.news2Title: Privacy-first approach: structured context, explicit consent
pressCenter.news2Text: SURSA is designed to keep structured text context rather than raw audio or video by default. External integrations are opt-in and should be enabled only when the user explicitly wants them. The system is built to support lawful, constructive use and to discourage risky or illegal behavior.
pressCenter.releasesItem1Text: Release notes will appear here as the project reaches stable milestones (local core, home awareness modules, and hardware prototype iterations). Each release will describe what changed, what is verifiably working, and what remains experimental.
pressCenter.releasesItem2Text: Updates published on this page aim to be checkable in real use: offline operation, local memory behavior, opt-in online mode, and clear boundaries around safety and data control. This press page prioritizes accuracy over hype.
pressCenter.archiveText: Older updates are archived to preserve long-term continuity. The goal is to document progress honestly: what was built, what was tested, and what principles remained unchanged.
pressCenter.archive2025Text: Foundation year: defining offline-first principles, building a working local core, and shaping the architecture for memory, tools, and home awareness.
pressCenter.archiveFutureText: Hardware prototype revisions, milestone releases, and safety advisories will be added as the project evolves. Major changes will be documented with clear scope and rationale.

forJournalists.heroTitle: A clear description of SURSA (no hype)
forJournalists.heroIntro: This page is a compact reference for media and researchers: what SURSA is, how to describe it accurately, key facts, and answers to common questions. We focus on verifiable claims and privacy-first principles.
forJournalists.howSentenceText: SURSA is a private offline-first AI assistant that runs on user-owned hardware, keeps long-term context as structured text, and supports home and daily work with explicit user control over any online access.
forJournalists.howShortText: SURSA is an offline-first AI assistant designed to live inside the home environment. It runs on hardware controlled by the user, stores long-term context as structured text, and can optionally access the internet only when the user requests it (for manuals, official instructions, and updates). The system is built for practical daily use, predictable behavior, and responsible, lawful assistance.
forJournalists.factsItem1: Offline-first: core reasoning and memory are local by design.
forJournalists.factsItem2: Memory model: structured text context (no raw audio/video stored by default).
forJournalists.factsItem3: Online access: opt-in, deliberate, and limited to explicit user requests.
forJournalists.factsItem4: Safety stance: the system discourages illegal or risky actions and suggests lawful alternatives.
forJournalists.factsItem5: Status: research & development initiative; no consumer device release date is announced here.
forJournalists.qa1Question: Is SURSA a finished consumer product?
forJournalists.qa1Answer: Not yet. The local core is operational and used in practical testing. Dedicated hardware prototypes are in development.
forJournalists.qa2Question: Does SURSA require constant internet access?
forJournalists.qa2Answer: No. The system is designed to work offline. Online mode is optional and should be triggered only for explicitly requested tasks (manuals, official instructions, fresh information).
forJournalists.qa3Answer: By default, it stores structured text context defined by the user. Raw audio/video storage is not part of the default design and would be opt-in if ever introduced.
forJournalists.contactText: For verified information, clarifications, or interview requests, contact the SURSA team via the official project channels. We can provide a short description, key facts, and accuracy review of technical wording before publication.
